channel.title: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?
channel.description:
I checked the AMD docs on how to INSTALL a processor, and they were talking about some thermal conductive crap on the heatsink. And because of that, I can't remove the heatsink once I installed it.
The problem is that I am about to buy a new motherboard, and I don't want to have to buy a new processor with it =/
So, is there anyway for me to transfer the whole processor with the heatsink over to another mobo? I can't just remove the processor and let the heatsink go with it, because the heatsink is actually wider than the processor -.- (noway to get to the release lever)

item.title: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

never having seen an amd heatsink i cant tell you specifically, but will either have 4 plastic …legs… or 2 clip sorta things, if it has clips they are easy enough to undo. if it has legs you will have to turn a thing on top of each (should have an arrow, may need a screwdriver)

yea, you can buy thermal grease it would probably have to be a shop dedicated to selling computer parts though

Read full topic
item.source: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?

item.title: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Two things,

  1. How the fuck do I remove the heatsink?

  2. You can BUY thermal conductive grease?

Read full topic
item.source: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?

item.title: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

You have to remove the heatsink (doing this will ruin the thermal grease/tape), unclip the CPU, do whatever you want to do with it, stick the CPU into the mobo, buy some thermal grease, put the grease ontop of the CPU in a nice even (thick) layer, reattach your heatsink

uuh if you would like me to retype that, just ask ;D

Read full topic
item.source: Anyway to actually TRANSFER a processor?
